info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cameron, west central Lafayette, southeastern Jefferson Davis, southeastern Evangeline, Acadia, northwestern Vermilion and central St. Landry Parishes through 330 PM CST... At 259 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mamou to near Lowry. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Crowley, Eunice, Jennings, Rayne, Ville Platte, Kaplan, Church Point, Mamou, Lake Arthur, Iota, Gueydan, Mermentau, Palmetto, Klondike, Evangeline, Sunset, Duson, Washington and Morse. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 61 and 93. Interstate 49 between mile markers 13 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
